new_hill_city.description: Fish's original home for 12 years, where the storm hit and forced him to leave

new_arrivals.description: Fish's first settlement after crossing the bridge, where he meets Niwra and gets his bearings

the_new_country.description: The entire country Fish explores as he travels northward

history_port_city.description: Fish's first stop on his journey north, with colonial buildings and rich heritage

lucky_city.description: The capital city, chaotic but charming, comparable to New Hill City

palm_island.description: Where the Goddess of Mercy statue is located, Fish's destination

floating_village.description: Community of houses on stilts over water, where Fish encounters the Monkey King statue

eagle_island.description: Northernmost tip of the new country, where Fish goes to recuperate and work on his assignment

cape_mangrove.description: Beautiful beach area with pristine waters and mangrove forests, where Fish experiences the motorbike rain storm

journey_flow.part_1: New Hill City (SG) → New Arrivals (JB) → History Port City (Melaka) → Lucky City (KL) → Palm Island (Penang)
journey_flow.future_parts: Will continue to Langkawi and beyond

key_characters.fish: Main character, displaced by storm, searching for belonging
key_characters.bird: First-person narrator, Fish's old friend from robotic project
key_characters.niwra: Fish's neighbor in New Arrivals, originally from Lucky City, helps Fish adapt
key_characters.luna: Fish's friend who cares for Hei (Fish's cat), has cats named Whiskers and Shadow
key_characters.kecik: Young worker in New Arrivals, fellow countryman, encourages Fish to travel
key_characters.hei: Fish's male cat, left with Luna when Fish had to leave

themes.displacement: Storm forces Fish to leave his home
themes.adaptation: Learning to survive and thrive in new places
themes.mystical_guidance: Dream encounters with Goddess of Compassion, willow branch symbolism
themes.human_connection: Friendship and kindness in unexpected places
